page.title: 12KATHRYN'S HOUSE
page.content: KATHRYN'S HOUSE BY GILLIAN HOUGH The site on which Kathryn's house was built, was originally the sand dunes. It was built up into quite a large extensive estate, about nine years ago. It has over fifty modernized four bedroomed houses and all of them have a front and back garden. The garden soil is not very good to plant in because the soil is so sandy that it is virtually impossible to plant anything there. Also, some of the houses on the estate have problems with crumbling foundations due to the sand that subsides, and dampness. The estate is in quiet surroundings and the speed limit has just been reduced to twenty miles per hour to make it safe for children to play in the streets.
